message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user wants me to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Uzbekistan. I need to provide responses for all 10 statements using the json_tool_call function.

Let me think about reasonable responses from the perspective of a teacher in Uzbekistan who would have practical understanding of both benefits and risks of AI in education:

TT4G35A - "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - AGREE (AI can definitely help with this)
TT4G35B - "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - AGREE (personalization is a clear benefit)
TT4G35C - "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - AGREE (individual support is possible)
TT4G35D - "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs" - AGREE (this is a well-documented benefit)
TT4G35E - "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - STRONGLY AGREE (this is clear and beneficial)
TT4G35F - "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - AGREE (this is a real concern/risk)
TT4G35G - "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - AGREE (this is a legitimate concern)
TT4G35H - "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - AGREE (this is a known risk)
TT4G35I - "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - AGREE (data privacy is a concern)
TT4G35J - "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students." - AGREE (this is a reasonable concern)

Let me structure these responses properly for the function call.
